title: Vlie is the early medieval name of the main outlet of the so-called Almere — now the Usselmeer — to the North Sea. It must have emptied into the North Sea somewhere between the isles of Vlieland and Terschelling. A useful reconstruction of the com­ plicated geographical situation around 700 is presented in J.C. Besteman, ‘North Holland AD 400-1200: Turning Tide or Tide Turned?’
